ObjectStates.Name: Infinite_Bag
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onObjectLeaveContainer(container, leave_object)
  if container == self then
    leave_object.setLuaScript(script)
    leave_object.setVar("parentGUID", self.getGUID())
  end
end

script = [===[
template = [[function onCollisionEnter(collision_info)
  if collision_info.collision_object.interactable then
    local target = collision_info.collision_object
    ---ENTER CUSTOM INTERACTION BELOW---
    --replace me--
    --example: target.lock()
  end
  self.destruct()
end]]

parentGUID = "]===]..self.getGUID()..[===["

function onLoad()
  self.createInput({
    input_function = "dummy"-- string (required),
    ,function_owner = self -- Object (required),
    --,label          = -- string,
    ,alignment      = 2-- int (1 = Automatic, 2 = Left, 3 = Center, 4 = Right, 5 = Justified),
    ,position       = {0,3,-0.4}-- Vector,
    ,rotation       = {0,180,0}-- Vector,
    ,scale          = {0.8,1,1}-- Vector,
    ,width          = 900 -- int,
    ,height         = 700-- int,
    ,font_size      = 40-- int,
  --  ,color          = {00,00,00}-- Color,
  --  ,font_color     = {255,255,255}-- Color,
    ,tooltip        = "input code here"-- Color,
    ,value          = template-- string,
    ,validation     = 1-- int (1 = None, 2 = Integer, 3 = Float, 4 = Alphanumeric, 5 = Username, 6 = Name),
    ,tab            = 3-- int (1 = None, 2 = Select Next, 3 = Indent),
    })
    self.createInput({
      input_function = "dummy"-- string (required),
      ,function_owner = self-- Object (required),
      --,label          = -- string,
      ,alignment      = 3-- int (1 = Automatic, 2 = Left, 3 = Center, 4 = Right, 5 = Justified),
      ,position       = {0,3,0.6}-- Vector,
      ,rotation       = {0,180,0}-- Vector,
      ,scale          = {0.8,1,1}-- Vector,
      ,width          = 400-- int,
      ,height         = 75-- int,
      ,font_size      = 40-- int,
      --,color          = -- Color,
      --,font_color     = -- Color,
      ,tooltip        = "Name your tool here"-- Color,
      ,value          = "CustomTool"-- string,
      ,validation     = 4-- int (1 = None, 2 = Integer, 3 = Float, 4 = Alphanumeric, 5 = Username, 6 = Name),
      ,tab            = 2-- int (1 = None, 2 = Select Next, 3 = Indent),
      })
    self.createButton({
      click_function = "createTool"-- string (required),
      ,function_owner = self-- Object (required),
      ,label          = "Create"-- string,
      ,position       = {0.35,3,0.42}-- Vector,
      ,rotation       = {0,180,0}-- Vector,
      ,scale          = {0.8,1,1}-- Vector,
      ,width          = 150-- int,
      --,height         = -- int,
      ,font_size      = 40-- int,
      --,color          = -- Color,
      --,font_color     = -- Color,
      ,tooltip        = "Create Custom tool"-- string,
    })
end
toolBag = nil
toolBall = nil
script = ""
function createTool()
  script = self.getInputs()[1].value
  local bagSpawnPos = {
    self.getPosition()[1],
    self.getPosition()[2] + 0.2,
    self.getPosition()[3]}
  local BallSpawnPos = {
    self.getPosition()[1],
    self.getPosition()[2] + 3,
    self.getPosition()[3]}
  local name = self.getInputs()[2].value
--[[  toolBag = spawnObject({
    type           = "Infinite_Bag"-- string,
    ,position       = bagSpawnPos-- Vector [x=0, y=3, z=0],
    --,rotation       = -- Vector [x=0, y=0, z=0],
    --,scale          = -- Vector [x=1, y=1, z=1],
    --,callback       = -- string,
    --,callback_owner = -- Object,
    --,sound          = -- bool,
    --,params         = -- Table,
    --,snap_to_grid   = -- bool,
  })]]
  --Copy/paste in inf bag that the creator came so that the float physics cary to the new tool
  --(you cannot edit a object's physics with code :/ )
  copy({getObjectFromGUID(parentGUID)})
  toolBag = (paste({position = bagSpawnPos}))[1]
  toolBag.setColorTint({0.627,0.125,0.941,1})
  toolBag.setName(name)
  toolBag.reset()
  toolBag.setLuaScript("")
  toolBall = spawnObject({
    type           = "Chinese_Checkers_Piece"-- string,
    ,position       = BallSpawnPos-- Vector [x=0, y=3, z=0],
    --,rotation       = -- Vector [x=0, y=0, z=0],
    ,scale          = {0.45,0.45,0.45}-- Vector [x=1, y=1, z=1],
    --,callback       = -- string,
    --,callback_owner = -- Object,
    --,sound          = -- bool,
    --,params         = -- Table,
    --,snap_to_grid   = -- bool,
  })
  toolBall.setLuaScript(script)
  toolBall.setColorTint({0.627,0.125,0.941,1})
  toolBall.setName(name)
end

function dummy()
end

]===]

ContainedObjects.LuaScript:
function onCollisionEnter(collision_info)
  if collision_info.collision_object.interactable then
    collision_info.collision_object.unlock()
  end
  self.destruct()
end

Text.Text:
Lock/Unlock: As the name implies
they will Lock or Unlock the target

Similarly, these two will change the
interactability of the target.
These two marbles are the only marbles
that CAN interact with a uninteractable
Copies the target above marble's position

I dont find this one as usefull but maybe you will
It will do the equivalent of pressing R on the target.
Will do diferent things depending on target type

The Main Attraction. Allow you to create any marble to fit your
needs, simply edit the template code and press create.
NOTE: it does not create a new inf bag, it copies the bag it came from
to preserve the physics settings, so don't delete the bag or change 
its state once you take the card out.
2ndNOTE: Placing the marble in the bag will also trigger the marble's
script on the bag, so if your script resizes the target, the bag
will resize as well.

SideNote: all bags have special physics,
and thus will float where ever you place them,
and thus don't need a table

Text.Text:
They are inf bags and thus can be used en mass by
holding the bag and repeatedly alt-RightClicking
or
simply taking a single marble out

Important Note:
the table is considerd an object, and
thus can be affected by the marbles
carful when droping the green ones
as if the table becomes interactable
any other marble can affect it
